resources.string: Full-body warm-up that boosts heart rate and circulation. Great for starting your workout.
Builds upper body strength using chest, shoulders, and triceps. Keep your core tight!
Strengthens legs and glutes while improving balance and posture.
Targets your core. Keep your body straight and engage abs for stability.
Cardio move that improves coordination and gets your heart pumping.
Works the glutes and lower back. Great for posture and core stability.
Targets the back of your arms. Use a sturdy chair or low bench.
Fast-paced core and cardio combo. Keep hips low and move knees quickly.

Strengthens obliques and improves core stability and posture.
Shoulder warm-up and toning exercise. Forward and backward circles.
Boosts leg strength and balance. Step forward, bend both knees, push back.
Dynamic core workout targeting abs and obliques.
Strengthens calves. Stand tall, lift heels off the ground, and lower slowly.
Improves flexibility and activates core and shoulders. Walk hands out to plank and back.
A challenging move that strengthens your core, glutes, and shoulders.
Back-strengthening move. Lie on your stomach and lift arms, legs, and chest.
Targets glutes. On all fours, kick one leg up and back.
Full-body move that builds strength and coordination. Crawl on all fours.
Works your upper abs. Lie down, reach toward your toes with legs straight.
Low-impact cardio. March while swinging arms for a steady warm-up or cool-down.
Rotational core exercise. Sit, lean back slightly, and twist side-to-side.
A modified push-up that builds upper body and core strength with less intensity.
An effective core move that targets the lower abdominal muscles.
A powerful lower-body move that combines strength and cardio for explosive leg training.
Targets lower abs. Lie down and kick legs up and down quickly.
A total-body movement that combines a squat and an overhead press to build strength and endurance.
Core stability and shoulder strength. Tap each shoulder without rocking hips.
A lower-body move that strengthens the legs and calves while challenging balance.
Total-body cardio move. Squat, jump into plank, push-up (optional), jump up.
